website_summaries.verdict: The ability to build any LEGO construction you can imagine in LEGO Worlds is far cheaper than buying tons of toy sets, and it’ll keep creative kids glued to their console.
pros: Immense environments packed with adorable LEGO secrets
Build anything you can think of with LEGO bricks
Available on Nintendo Switch, Xbox One, and PS4

customer_reviews.title: EUROPEAN EDITION not the USA one
customer_reviews.text: You need to tell people that this is the European edition & NOT the USA since it comes with the DLC package that you can't download and get an error. The game is still Playable, but nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: Angela @ Angel's Guilty Pleasures

customer_reviews.title: If your child loves legos but you're tired of stepping on them, get this instead!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't played this lego game myself as it was a present for my 9 year old Nephew. I know for a fact kids get bored of things relatively quickly so I was shocked at the fact he didn't want to put the game down even after a month of use. There were times where he was confused on certain levels and it took him a while to pass, but he did it eventually all on his own!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny M

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love Lego city undercover game. So much to do. Its look is seamless and have been playing non stop for a month and still only 17% done with the game. This lego worlds game is so hard to see and buggs starting from the first level. Not a seller issue it's the game itself. Not a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kristan

customer_reviews.title: EU Version, so DLC doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: This is the EU version, not the US version, so the DLC included in the package cannot be used in the US. 3 stars removed because, while the game works in the US, it will cost $8 to replace the free content that WB Games packaged with all versions of this game (via region-specific DLC code), and because the seller does not list that it is the EU version.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: ... nephews are 9 and 6 and this was their favorite game they received
customer_reviews.text: My nephews are 9 and 6 and this was their favorite game they received!
customer_reviews.author: MARKYMARK

customer_reviews.title: 🤩 WOW, DLCs are included!
customer_reviews.text: Two DLCs are actually included for free!!! That’s so good it’s like a 7 dollar discount cuz that’s how much they sell the two DLCs in the eShop. Happy with the game :D
customer_reviews.author: • A l e x •

customer_reviews.title: Becomes repetitive with the “tasks” and “challenges” after a short time...
customer_reviews.text: Becomes repetitive with the “tasks” and “challenges” after a short time...
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing game
customer_reviews.text: I tried playing this game once because I was intrigued by the building/exploration aspects shown in gameplay trailers. I've also enjoyed tons of other LEGO games in the past and had high expectations for this game. Unfortunately, the controls are super clunky on my Switch and the camera is difficult to control. This game feels like a poor Minecraft imitation. The gameplay also feels incredibly basic (most of the quests are to retrieve items) and gets stale very quickly. Honestly the only pro I can say is that the islands are pretty large and are fun to explore for a brief period.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Passable for kids but...
customer_reviews.text: It's just not fun, especially on the switch. The controls are clunky and missions are too easy. This is a $10-$15 game max.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: EMPTY CASE: NO GAME- disappointing Easter basket for sure!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed kid when he opened his Easter basket to find an empty game case. I just don't understand what kind of sick joke you provided for a child and left a sole parent to have to handle alone. Awful. I've ordered many things off Amazon without issues and then this and it's probably the most important thing. Seriously completely empty case-no game, no instructions/game booklet, just an empty case and lots of tears from my son. Very not cool!!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal A Faust

customer_reviews.title: Bought as gift for my nephew and he played for ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought as gift for my nephew and he played for hours straight and said the game has so much to do.
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

customer_reviews.title: ... well for a while and i had alot of fun but when i wanted to start the dragon unlocking ...
customer_reviews.text: it worked very well for a while and i had alot of fun but when i wanted to start the dragon unlocking missions it glitched them up so much i could not though they might fix that with updates
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too many game-stopping bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Tt made an update, and now it's even worse. It's literally unplayable now and I wish I could get a full refund. How disappointing! Not a half-bad entry into the creative procedurally generated genre, but it suffers from far too many game-stopping bugs. Sometimes it doesn't generate terrain, other times it won't alter it, which is pretty much the entire point. Many game restarts will be in order if you play this. Tt needs to step up their bug squashing game. This is ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Happy seven year old grandson
customer_reviews.text: Grandson loves this game him and grandpa played together graphics are very well photo the colors are bright and brilliant haven’t had a problem with the video seven-year-old grandson is very happy
customer_reviews.author: Brenda L. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: It’s a fun LEGO game. It sticks to the traditional LEGO game, meaning you do a task to move to the next part until you finish the game.

customer_reviews.title: Nice game

customer_reviews.title: This game has a ton of problems and does not work correctly 75% of the time.
customer_reviews.text: This game is barely playable. It constantly freezes and constantly crashes. At one point after playing for about 5 hours I was stuck in the game because the mission would not reload after a crash refusing to give me the mission to complete. I did let my game sit and wait for a few hours to see if it would pass on and let me continue or at least try the mission. Avoid this game and get something else more worth your time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game on PC, confusing controls on the Switch
customer_reviews.text: My kids (5 and 7) love this game on the PC and are able to play it fairly independently. However, the controls are so confusing on the Switch that it is just no fun for them. The controls are even confusing for me (it took me 5 minutes just to figure out how get to the "build buildings" menu) and I consider myself to be very proficient at that sort of thing. Controls aside, the game is great. Lots of worlds, things to explore and do, very imaginative. My kids never cared for Minecraft, but they love Lego Worlds.
customer_reviews.author: Landon

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to really be enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: This is the second game that I bought for the Switch. I found it to be disappointingly difficult. The game doesn't do a good job of explaining what needs to be done. I got frustrated with it pretty quickly. Not a lot of humor or good dialogue. I made it to the 4th planet (moon base) and I have no idea what they want me to do to complete any of the quests. I will be less likely to buy other Lego games in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Barry P

customer_reviews.title: Kid friendlt, but also fun for adults  (LEGO ON THE GO!)
customer_reviews.text: I have this game on ps4 and the switch. I love being able to take it on the go. I like the game itself as allows you to use your imagination which is rare in a lot of games these days. Kid friendly, but also fun for adults.
customer_reviews.author: lagoveride

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy playing it myself also

customer_reviews.title: Switch version broken after last patch.
customer_reviews.text: The game ran serviceable at first, with some bad Fran drops, however the last update broke rhe game completely. The core game is fun, bur wpild not recommend in it's current state.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego experience at home or on the go.
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased this for PS4, but I was willing to double-dip due to the Switch's portability. The content and visuals here is comparable to the PS4 version which I was already having a blast with. Definitely a worthy buy for fans of the Lego videogames with hours of gameplay to be had and a different experience for everyone person who plays.
customer_reviews.author: Dvazquez5138

customer_reviews.title: It's not perfect, but it's not bad

customer_reviews.title: I love Lego Worlds!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving Lego Worlds on the Switch. I had passed on getting it for other consoles when I heard that it would be coming out on Nintendo's newest console. There are a lot of aspects of Lego Worlds that I like more than Minecraft such as being able to copy and the variety of objects is immense. I highly recommend this to anyone who has a creative mind and those who love Legos and Minecraft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Freezes and Glitches
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yr old and 7 yr old like this game. The first couple of days were fine and then the program started freezing. It would not allow two players after the first day. It took 5 reboots this morning to get it working. Try explaining that to a crying 5 yr old. Nintendo needs to work the bugs out of their programming.before offering it for sale!! Very disappointed in this game.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia flick

He has 6 other Switch games that have never froze his Switch. I wish it was otherwise cause he seems to enjoy it till it freezes.

product_meta.title: LEGO Worlds - Nintendo Switch
product_meta.description: Platform:Nintendo SwitchEXPLORE. DISCOVER. CREATE. TOGETHER. LEGO Worlds is an open environment of procedurally generated Worlds made entirely of LEGO bricks which you can freely manipulate and dynamically populate with LEGO models. Create anything you can imagine one brick at a time, or use large scale landscaping tools to create vast mountain ranges and dot your world with tropical islands. Drop in prefabricated structures to build and customize any world to your liking. Explore using helicopters, dragons, motorbikes or even gorillas and unlock treasures that enhance your gameplay. Watch your creations come to life through characters and creatures that interact with you and each other in unexpected ways. In LEGO Worlds, anything is possible!
feature_bullets: Experience a galaxy of Worlds made entirely from LEGO bricks
LEGO Worlds is an open environment of procedurally generated Worlds made entirely of LEGO bricks which you can freely manipulate and dynamically populate with LEGO models
Create anything you can imagine one brick at a time, or use large scale landscaping tools to create vast mountain ranges and dot your world with tropical islands
Explore using helicopters, dragons, motorbikes or even gorillas and unlock treasures that enhance your game play
Watch your creations come to life through characters and creatures that interact with you and each other in unexpected ways

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars979 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
